title: Pulmonary alveolus
summary: A pulmonary alveolus (plural: alveoli, from Latin alveolus, "little cavity") also known as an air sac or air space is one of millions of hollow, distensible cup-shaped cavities in the lungs where oxygen is exchanged for carbon dioxide.[1] Alveoli make up the functional tissue of the lungs known as the lung parenchyma, which takes up 90 percent of the total lung volume.[2][3]
